page.title: 10LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: Recreation - Leisure Activities. There are flourishing groups of Scouts, Cubs, Beavers, Girl Guides, Brownies and Horse Rangers, with a Youth Club nearby at Sandford. Gardeners are well-catered for, with the Growmore Club and the Horticultural Society. The parish church has a team of bellringers. The Women's Institute, and the Sunshine Club for the over-60's meet regularly and the Auld Acquaintance Committee raise money for an annual party for the elderly. For those whose interests lie in party politics, there are clubs for Conservatives and Liberals. There is a Cricket Club and Gun Club, while darts, snooker and other pub games can be played at "The Griffin" and "The Taverners" as well as at the Sports and Social Club in the Village Hall.
